TEI:
&teiHeader; &facsimile;
60 [Iohan ap.]
SEint Iohan þe ewangelist : þat Apostel is,
was ore louerdes Aunte sone : and seint Iemes broþur, i-wis:
his Moder was ore lauedie suster : Marie cleophe,
I-wedded heo was to is fader : þat hiet zebede;
Þis Zebede hadde twei&yogh;e sones : bi Marie is wif:
Þes seint Iohan and eke seint Ieme : þat ladden wel holi lijf.
¶ Seint Iohan was &yogh;onguore þane ore louerd: twelf monþe oþur þere-a-boute;
For is kun he was þe betere Man : þar-of nis no doute:
And natheles he was, ich wene : þritti &yogh;er old nei&yogh;h
Are hee ou&yogh;t muche of ore louerd wuste : oþer are he him muche isei&yogh;h.
For ore louerd nas bote luyte i-knowe : ne he ne cudde him nou&yogh;t
Are he i-baptized were : and to cristine-dom i-brou&yogh;t;
And &yogh;eot ne cudde he him nou&yogh;t a-brod : are seint Iohan þe baptist were
I-martred for þe lawe of holie churche : þat he gan heroudes lere.
¶ Ake þo seint Iohan i-martred was : ore louerd ne sparede nou&yogh;ht
Forto gon and prechi a-boute : til he was to deþe i-brou&yogh;t.
To beon is desciples furst he ches : twei&yogh;e breþren þo :
Seint petre and seint Andreu : ase he cam bi þe se go;
And þare he sai&yogh;h tweie breþren þo : seint Ieme and þes seint Iohan,
with þe olde man Zebede : heore fader, a-fischeth gon :
¶ heom he cleopede al-so to him : and huy bi-lefden a-non
heore fader, and siweden him : and token þe betere won.
Seint Iohan was best with him : of is desciples echon :
Þat was i-sene þo he leonede : and slep opon is breoste-bon;
For þe &yogh;wile he made is cene : ase on schere-þores-day,
Seint Iohan among is desciples : to is swete breste lay.
A-morewe, ase on þe guode friday : ase he deide on þe rode,
his swete moder and seint Iohan : faste bi him stode :
Þere in seint Iohanes warde : is swete moder he tok,
To wardi ase hire owene sone : ase we findez i-write in bok.
¶ hire wardein he was aftur also : þat he to heouene i-wende,
Al þe &yogh;wyle þat heo on eorþe was : for-to he aftur hire sende.
Ri&yogh;ht it was to wardi hire : &yogh;wane heo is Aunte was,
And for þare nas non oþur[al. noþer] of heom : þat clene mayde was;[al. nas]
Clene mayde to wardi oþur : ri&yogh;ht it was i-do[al. to do]—
Þare-fore in is swete warde : ore louerd bi-tok hire so.—
Aftur þat ore louerd was : to þe Ioye of heouene i-went,
And his desciples a-witsonenday : þene holi gost hadde i-sent,
¶ huy wenden forth wel baldeliche : euerech in is side,
A-boute in diuerse londes : and precheden wel wide.
In-to þe londe of Asye : seint Iohan þe ewangelist
wende, to wissi þulke side : and prechede of Iesu crist.
To þe Cite of Efese : atþe laste he com,
Þare he hadde him-sulue hous and hom : and prechede cristindom.—
¶ Þe Aumperour domician : þat luþur was i-nov&yogh;h,
Alle þe cristine Men þat he fond : he tormentede oþur a-slou&yogh;h.
So þat seint Iohan was i-nome : þat longue hadde beo i-sou&yogh;ht;
Bi-fore þe Aumperores Iustise : ful sone[al. to rome] he was i-brou&yogh;t.
Þe Iustise þou&yogh;hte anon : fram god to tuyrne is þou&yogh;ht.
"Certes," quath þis holie Man : "þare-to ne bringest þou it nou&yogh;t;
For ichulle more don after god : þane aftur þe, i-wis."
Welle, wrothþ was þe Iustise : þo he i-heorde þis!
Ane tonne ful of Eoyle he nam : and liet it boylie faste,
And al wallinde þesne holie Man : a-midde þe eolie he caste.
¶ Seint Iohan þare-inne sat : so longue so it was,
he ne chaungede neuer ene his hiev : ne neuere þe worse him nas,
Ake al hol with-outen eni harm : out of þis eolye he a-ros—
Þe Iustise þat him þer-inne brou&yogh;te : þar-of wel sore a-gros.
Þis was in rome bi-fore a &yogh;at : þat þis dede was i-do,
Þat men cleopeden "þe porte latin" : and &yogh;uyt men doth also.
A-seint Iohanes day it was : in þe bi-ginningue of may.
For þulke miracle men holdez &yogh;uyt : þoru al þe lond is day;
And for þat &yogh;at hiet "porte latyn" : þare þe dede was i-do,
&YOGH;uy[t] men holdeth[al. writ] þilke day : of seint Iohan[al. of porte latyn] al-so.—
¶ Domician þe Aumperour : þo he i-sai&yogh;h þis cas
Þat seint Iohan nas no-þe worse : þat he in þe eolie was,
wod-wroth he was and sori i-nou&yogh;h : ake natheles he ne dorste nou&yogh;t
For cristine Men, þat he were : þoru&yogh; him to deþe i-brou&yogh;ht;
he hiet him fleo out of þe londe : þat non more he ne come þere.
I-harled he was out of rome : ase þei he strong þeof were,
And i-outlawed ase a þeof : þat he in þe contreye ne come.
Into þe yle of patmos : he wende out of rome,
And wonede þare in penaunce : twelf monþes nei&yogh;h.
Of ore louerdes priuetez : wel muche he þare i-sei&yogh;h,
For ofte þe priuetez of heouene : ore louerd him schewede þere.
&YOGH;ware-of he made þare ane bok : al-holi churche to lere,
þat men cleopeth "Apocalips" : þat men redez in churche al day;
Muche is of godes priuetez : þat he þare i-sai&yogh;.[orig. i sai&yogh;h]—
¶ Þe furste &yogh;er þat seint Iohan: þus i-outlawed was,
Of þe Aumperour þat him drof awey : þare bi-feol a sori cas :
For þe senatour him a-slov&yogh; : þat was þo of rome,
In contek þat heom was bi-twene— : for huy conteckeden i-lome.
Seint Iones pays was sone i-cried : and alle oþeres also
Þat weren þoru&yogh; þe Aumperour : in outlawingue ido.
Seint Iohan him wende a-&yogh;einward þo : mildeliche i-nov&yogh;;
Toward þe cite of Efese : to is owene hous he drou&yogh;—
For he hadde þare hous and hom : and kun and freond i-nowe.
Men and wimmen of þe toun : wel þicke a-&yogh;ein him drowe,
To wel-comien him with grete Ioye : and in-to toune him brou&yogh;te,
with swiþe gret procession : ase huy ful wel ou&yogh;ten.
¶ Ase huy wenden þoru&yogh; þe toun : with grete Ioye þere,
Men and wimmen a-&yogh;ein heom comen : with ful dreorie chere :
For drusiane, a ded womman : toward vrþe huy bere;
Þare was for hire deol i-nov&yogh; : and wel sorie alle huy were.
Gret loue þare hadde er i-beo : bi-tweone hire and seint Iohan.
Ase sone ase þat folk him i-sai&yogh; : þe gladdore alle huy were a-non;
huy gonne on him to crie faste : "sire," huy seiden, "þin ore!
Þis is drusiane, þi guode freond : þat was vnder þi lore.
Þou wost wel heo hath þe muche i-loued : nov ne may heo nonmore,
here heo is in þis bere ded : heo makez us carie sore.
¶ Heo ne wilnede non oþur þing : þe &yogh;wile heo sik lay,
Bote þat he[= heo] moste þe i-seon : are hire ende-day :
And nouþe it is so ase þou sixt : þat, þei þou beo here, heo ne may!
Þench on þe loue þat heo þe louede : sethþe heo þe furst i-say;
And &yogh;if þou woldest us swuch grace do : and a-&yogh;ein to liue hire bringue,
Euere we scholden herie þe : and þe kingue of alle kyngue."
¶ seint Iohan bi-gan to sichen sore : ase he in þou&yogh;hte were;
he bad heom ane stounde a-bide : and setten a-doun þe bere.
he sat a-doun wel softe a-kneo : and criede to ore louerd þere,
Þis woman þat him so muche louede : &yogh;if it were is wille, a-rere.
Þo he hadde i-seid is oresun : anon-ri&yogh;ht in þe place
Þis womman a-ros up hol and sound : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace,
And herede faste ihesu crist : and þene holie man sein Iohan—
Þare was prece of alle þe men : þat þudere mi&yogh;hten gon.
Seint Iohan bad hire go hom a-non : and greyþi som-þing to mete
Athom in hire owene hous : þat he mi&yogh;hte with hire ete.
¶ Þeos drusiane wente forth : and &yogh;a[r]kede mete i-nov&yogh;,
And made seint Iohan fair semblaunt : and elles it were wou&yogh;.—
[fol. not numbered]In þe cite of Efese : seint Iohan bi-lefde longue,
And prechede þat folk to gode tuyrne : and cristindom a-fongue,
And ordeinede preostes : and churchene liet a-rere,
Bischopes he made beste Men : þat folk for-to lere.
Þis guode Men þat vnder him weren : bischopes and oþere also,
Fondeden boþe ni&yogh;ht and day : aftur is wissingue do.
huy crieden on him with al hore mi&yogh;hte : alle of one[al. þe] cite :
For he wuste so muche and vnder-&yogh;at : of ore louerdes priuete
Þe &yogh;wile he with him on eorþe was : and next him euere also,
Þat he scholde of is holie lijf : in sum guode bok do,
And of is kuynde &yogh;wat he was : and þat folk don to lore,[al. aboute lere]
Þat huy mi&yogh;hten þe betere iwite : &yogh;wat ore swete louerd wore.
¶ Seint Iohan bi-sou&yogh;te þat folk &yogh;eorne : for him þat huy bede
In fastingue and in orisones : to don a swuch holi dede;
And wende into a derne stude : and bad ore louerd faste
Þat he scholde þene holie gost : into is heorte caste,
Þe holie Godspel of him to make : al-holie churche to lere,
&YOGH;ware-þoru&yogh; euerech cristine man : þe betere bi-lieued were.
he bad al-so þat þare ne scholde : þoru&yogh; ore louerdes grace
wind. ne reyn. ne oþur weder : come nei&yogh;him in þat place
To letten him of is holie dede : þe &yogh;wyle he þare-a-boute were.
Ore louerd heorde is bone wel : þat no weder ne lette him þere,
Ne cam no wynd &yogh;eot to þis day : ase þe holie Man it bad,
Ne oþur tempeste in þulke stude : as þe bok was i-mad,[al. a v. more: Holi is þe bok when so holi is þe stede]
Ne[al. þat þer ne] mi&yogh;hte neuereft come tempeste : ase þe holie man it bad.[hadde ibede]
A-non so seint Ion bi-gan : to don þis holie dede,
I-tend he was of þe holie gost : þat ech del þat he seide
he sek of ore louerdes breoste : ase he þar-to lay
Þe &yogh;wile he made is swete cene : a-schere-þoresday;
Þare he sek out þat holie wit : of þe holie godspelle
Þat he made sethþe in Efese : a-mong cristine Men to telle.
he was þe feorþe Ewangelist : and herre nas þare non;
And is godspel he made last : of heom euerechon.
Seint Matheu and seint Mark : and eke seint luc, i-wis,
heore god-spelles huy hadden longue i-maud : are he bi-guonne his.
Ake seint Iohan bi-gan his hext : for þare-on he bi-gan
Of ore louerd al &yogh;wat he was : are þat he were Man;
he bi-gan so hei&yogh;e is godspel[MS. godspell] : of ore louerdes kuynde, i-wis,
Þat vnneþe ani Man eorþelich : entendeth &yogh;wat it is.
For he sou&yogh;hte so deope is kuynde : and of him bi-gan so hei&yogh;e,
In þe fourme of Ane Ern he is de-peint : ase we ofte i-seoth with ei&yogh;e.
For þe Ern is swiftest[r. sucth (= seoth) best] of alle foules : and hext he may fleo:
For &yogh;wane he is in þe lofte an hei&yogh;h : þat herre ne may non beo,
&YOGH;uyt he may here in þe grounde : ane luttle worm i-seo;[al. a v. more : & ate se-gronde a smal fisch : to chese wider to teo.]
Also he may so hei&yogh;e fleo : and þe firmament so nei&yogh;h,
Þat almest is wyngene brenneth : &yogh;wane he is so hei&yogh;h.
¶ Se[al. Seint (Se)] Iohan þat is[al. is in] þe fourme of Ern : is godspelles wel hei&yogh;e bi-gan,
Þare-inne he tolde al is[al. our louerdes] lif : þe &yogh;wile he was on eorþ man.
his godspel is swiþe hei&yogh; i-holde : ase wel ri&yogh;ht it is,
For muche del of holi churche : þer-þoru&yogh;h i-loked is.
Seint Iohan cudde þis godspel sone : and prechede it faste al-so;
&YOGH;eot þare weren luþere men : þat onde hadden þare-to.—
¶ On atyme manie luþere Men : to-gadere heom hadden i-nome
And to seint Iohan þe ewangelist : in grete wrathþe come
And heten him wende forth with heom : to heore maumates a non
And a-nouri as forth with heom : oþur it scholde an-oþur gon.
"Beu freres," quath þis holie Man : "ichulle segge eou a sothþ—
Ich habbe reuþe of eov in mine heorte : þat &yogh;e nutez &yogh;wat &yogh;e dothþ.
Ichulle don eou chois of tweiy þingues : and þarof cheose &yogh;e:
To gon[al. þat ich go] with eou to eower temple : oþur &yogh;e to churche with me;
¶ &YOGH;wane &YOGH;e to godes churche comieth : &yogh;if &yogh;e þoru&yogh; eower godes lawe
Mouwen make þe churche to falle : bi-lieue ichulle on heom fawe;
And &yogh;if ich may bi[al. so] eower temple : bi-fore eower owene si&yogh;hte,
Bi-leueth on Ihesu crist, ich rede : &yogh;wane &yogh;e i-seothþ is mi&yogh;hte."
"We grauntiez wel," þis oþure seiden : "þou schalt furst bi-guynne
To cuyþe þine louerdes mi&yogh;hte : þe maistrie forto wynne."
To þe false temple huy wenden furst : and þo huy weren þare-nei&yogh;h alle,
Seint Iohan bad heom stonde fer : þat huy ne weren of-falle.
¶ Þo huy weren alle with-drawen a-feor : seint Iohan a-feor stod;
"I-seo &yogh;e," he seide, "þis temple alle : þat &yogh;e holdeth so guod?
Ich hote hire in mine louerdes name : þat heo falle a-non,
Þat &yogh;e mowen þe soþe i-seon : bi-fore eou here ech-on."
Ne hadde he bote þat word i-seid : þat heo ne ful up þe doun,
Fram ende to oþur, al þis temple : with swiþe grislich soun.
¶ Þo al þat folk þat þare stod : þis miracle i-sei&yogh;h,
huy gonne to crien on Ihesu crist : and on seint Iohan an hei&yogh;h;
Twelf þousend Men þare torneden : echone to cristindom,
with-oute children and wimmen : þat turneden also mani on.—
¶ ARistodimus, þe Bischop : and Maister of þe lawe,
&YOGH;uyt ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;ht seint Iohan : to ore louerd is herte drawe:
For þo he isai&yogh;h þis faire miracle : þat þe temple ful so þere,
&YOGH;eot nolde he it nou&yogh;ht i-leue : þat ani miracle it were;
he nolde i-lieue in none manere : þat ore louerd were of mi&yogh;hte.
Seint Iohan stod and þou&yogh;hte longue : hou he him mi&yogh;hte bringue best to ri&yogh;hte,
¶ And seide, "sei&yogh;e þou me &yogh;wat i schal do : þat þou bi-fore þe i-seo;
And bote &yogh;if ich it do, ne lief þou nou&yogh;ht : þat mi louerd al-mi&yogh;hti beo."
"Par fey," quath þis luþere Man : "nov ichulle herkni þe;
Do nouþe þat ichulle þe segge : and þou schalt winne me.
Venim ich habbe, strong i-nov&yogh;h : þat ho-so þarof nimeth ou&yogh;t,
Ne come þere with-inne him neuere so luyte : to deþe he worthþ i-brou&yogh;t;
[This verse is doubled in the MS.]Drink þare-of bi-fore[MS. b : atfore] mine eyene[Ey&yogh;en] : and &yogh;if it ne greueth[greuez] þe nou&yogh;ht,
To Ihesu crist, þat is þi god : ichulle take al mi þou&yogh;ht."
"Þou seist wel i-nou&yogh;," quath seint Iohan : "bring nouþe hidere to me
Þat strongue venym, and ichulle : hit drinke bi-fore þe."
¶ Þe false Bischop him bi-þou&yogh;the : for-to a-gasten him þe sarrore þere,
And also to seon þe soþe : þat his god of pouwer were:
Twey men þare weren, to deþe i-dempt : for heore luþere dede,
Þe false bischop dude hem boþe : bi-fore seint Iohan lede
And made heom drinke of þat venym : ri&yogh;th bi-fore is ey&yogh;e.
A-non so it ou&yogh;t with-inne hem cam : boþe huy gonne dey&yogh;e.
¶ Seint Iohan sethþe þe coppe tok : þo he isai&yogh;h al þis cas,
And dronk þare-of ane grete drau&yogh;t : and neuere þe worse him nas,
Ake euere þe lengore þare-aftur-ward : þe more Ioye he made and blis
Þat folk stod al in gret wonder : þo huy i-sei&yogh;en al þis.
¶ huy stoden and bi-heolden sein Iohan longue : þre tidene and more,
And euere þe leng þe gladdore : huy sei&yogh;en him for al his sore:
To Ie[s]u crist huy gonne tuyrne : and criden merci a-non;
So þat huy to cristine-dom : þare turnde, wel many on.
¶ Ake Aristod[i]mus þe Bischop : was euere in luþere þou&yogh;te,
And ne bi-liefde nou&yogh;ht in Iesu crist : for al þat he þare wrou&yogh;te.
"&YOGH;wat fayllez þe &yogh;uyt?" quath seint Iohan : "me þunchez it is with wou&yogh;h
Þat þou ne leuest ore louerdes mi&yogh;hte— : ne sixt þou nou&yogh;t &yogh;uyt i-nov&yogh;?"[This v. on the margin.]
"Bote þou most &yogh;uyt," quath þe Bischop : "þe dede to liue a-rere
Þat to deþe with þis venym : a-poysoned nou ri&yogh;ht were."
"Þou seist nouþe ful wel," quath seint Iohan : "ake þat þou þe soþe i-seo,
I-nelle nou&yogh;t mi-sulf ney hem[MS. him] come : ake ope þe it schal al beo.
Nim mine cuyrtel here to þe : and lei&yogh;e ope hem a-non,[MS. anom]
And in þe name of Iesu crist : hot heom a-rise a[nd][MS. a] gon."
¶ Þe bischop nam seint Iohanes Cuyrtel : bi-fore ri&yogh;ht þe Iustise,
And leide ope þe dede and het heom þo : in ore louerdes name a-rise.
A-non so he hadde þis word i-seid : þis men a-risen a-non
And &yogh;eoden forth hole and sounde : and þonkeden seint Iohan.
¶ Þe bischop, þo he þis i-sei&yogh;h : and þe Iustise al-so,
Criden merci Iesu crist : of þat huy hadden misdo,
And torneden þare to cristinedom : and oþur folk also i-nou&yogh;h,
For þe faire miracle þat huy seyen : and elles it were wou&yogh;h.—
¶ Þe Miracle þat seint Iohan dude : no toungue telle ne may&yogh;;
Þare-fore folk him siwede faste : þat is miracle i-say&yogh;.
Tweye Ioliue louerdingues and wilde : þat &yogh;oungue and Ioliue[al. stronge] were,
Siweden him and duden al-so : ase he gan heom lere:
¶ Furst huy solden al heore god : þat heom ne bi-lefde nou&yogh;th,
And turnden hem al to Iesu crist : heore heorte and al heore þou&yogh;ht,
And siweden[MS. siwenden] sein Iohan swiþe faste : þat þare-to heom hadde i-brou&yogh;ht;
And he heom prechede of Iesu crist : þat deore heom hadde i-bou&yogh;ht.
¶ Þis twei&yogh;e &yogh;ongue men ase huy &yogh;eoden : swyþe riche men and hei&yogh;e
with grete nobleye and pruyde i-nou&yogh; : bi þe weye huy sei&yogh;e;
Þou&yogh;ten huy, "swuch nobleye : we weren i-woned to lede
In Iolifte and in pruyte i-nou&yogh; : and nouþe we beoth in wrech-hede,
In Miseyse and in pouerte : and riche weren bi-fore!
vs þinkez, sorie mouwe we beon[MS. bieon] : þat we euere weren ibore."
Seint Iohan wuste al heore heorte : þei he ne heorde þare-of nou&yogh;ht:
"&YOGH;e foles," he seide, "&yogh;wat is eou nouþe? : &yogh;wi chaunge &yogh;e eouwer þou&yogh;ht?
Bowes and &yogh;eordene fechchiez me : and stones al-so!"
Þis &yogh;ongue Men weren þare-a-boute a-non : þat þe dede were i-do.
¶ Seint Iohan tornede þis &yogh;eordene sone : in-to puyr gold and cler,
And þe stones to &yogh;immes preciouse : þoru&yogh;h ore louerdes pouwer,
And þis twei wilde Bachilers : he &yogh;af it euer-ech del;
"Here-with," he seide, "&yogh;e mouwen : habbe wel manie guode Mel,
And also muche lond eou bugge a-&yogh;ein : and more þane &yogh;e solden bi-fore;
For &yogh;e habbuth, bote &yogh;e betere do : þe Ioye of heouene fur-lore."
¶ Þis &yogh;ongue Men nomen þis tresour : and wel glade þar-of were,
And to manie goldsmiþes : wel wide-a-bouten it bere.
Þis goldsmiþes sworen euer-ech-on : þat þis gold i-sei&yogh;en,
Þat so clene gold ne so puyr : huy ne sei&yogh;en neuere with ei&yogh;en.
¶ Hou mi&yogh;te fairore miracle beo : oþur fairore poer,
Þat[al. þen] bowes and &yogh;eordene tornede[al. torne] þare : in so puyr gold and cler?—
¶ Al-so[al. As] seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : ferrore wende þere,
And þe twey men forth with him : þat so riche of golde were,[This v. on the margin.]
A ded man toward burijngue : Men brou&yogh;hten ope one bere.
Þe Moder criede opon sein Iohan : þat he him scholde arere,
"Louerd," heo seide, "ich bidde þe : þat þou habbe reuþe of me
And of mi sone þat is ded : ibrou&yogh;t here a-&yogh;ein þe;
haue reuþe of him, ich bidde þe : for Iesues woundes fiue,
Ase þou haddest of Drusiane : þo þou a-rerdest hire to liue!"
¶ Þo gan seint Iohan to weope sore : and bad a-stunte þe bere,
And bad ore louerd for is grace : þat dede bodi a-rere.
Þis &yogh;ongue man a-non with þis word : to liue a-ros þere.
Þo was Ioye and blisse i-nou&yogh;h : a-mong alle þat þare were!
¶ "Ich hote þe nouþe," quath seint Iohan : "þat ded hast i-beo &yogh;are,
Þat þou telle þis men sum-þing : of þat þou sei&yogh;e elles-&yogh;ware,
And nameliche here to þis twei men : þat nouþe beoth for-lore,
Þat beoth itornede to þe deuele a-&yogh;ein : to &yogh;wam huy serueden bi-fore."
¶ Þis &yogh;ongue Man þat was to liue a-rerd : bi-heold þeos oþure twei&yogh;e;
"Allas," he seide, "þe wrechhede : þat ich i-seo[al. isei] bi eou bei&yogh;e!
Þulke time þat &yogh;e for-soken : þis holie Mannes lore,
Aungles þat eou wusten er : weopen for eou ful sore,
And &yogh;uyt huy doth ase ich nou ri&yogh;ht i-sei&yogh;h : and þe deuelene in heore ende
¶ Mauden for eou Ioye i-nou&yogh;h : to &yogh;wam &yogh;e gonne wiende.
Allas, wrechches, þe muchele pine : þat to eou is al-&yogh;are,
Þat in helle ich sai&yogh;h to eouwer bi-hoffþe : to &yogh;wan &yogh;e schullen fare!"
Þo þis twei Men i-heorden þis : huy bi-gonne to crie a-non,
Deol and seoruwe huy mauden i-nou&yogh;h : and gradden opon seint Iohan.
"Allas, &yogh;e foles[&yogh;e f. overlined.]," quath seint Iohan : "&yogh;e nuteth &yogh;ware &yogh;e wollez beo.
&YOGH;if god wolle habbe merci of eou : &yogh;e mouwen sone i-seo.
To ech sunful man he is redi : þat to him wole i-wiende;
Þare-fore criez &yogh;eorne on him : for-to he eou milce siende:
And þe soþe &yogh;e mouwen sone under-&yogh;ite : &yogh;wane he hath eou milce i-sent,
&YOGH;wane þis gold and þeos &yogh;immes : to heore kuynde beoth a-&yogh;en i|went."
¶ Huy crieden &yogh;eorne on ore louerd þo : and in penaunce huy were,
In fastingue and in oresones : þritti dawes þere.
Þo tur[n]de þat gold bi-fore heore ei&yogh;ene : into bowes of treo,
And þe &yogh;ymmes into harde stones : ase huy hadden er i-beo.
¶ Þo þis &yogh;ongue men þis i-sei&yogh;en : glade huy weren i-nou&yogh;h!
Þudere a-&yogh;ein ase huy fetten heom er : huy beren euer-ech bou&yogh;h,
And for-soken al þe worldes pruyte : and duden ase þe wise,
And endeden heore lif atþe laste : in ore louerdes seruise.—
[Perdrix.]¶ In a time ase þis holie man : wende in þe contreye,
A &yogh;ong partrich he bar on his hond : and þare-with he gan pleye.
A wylde louerdyng þare cam gon : a-&yogh;ein him bi þe weye,
I-wepned swiþe baldeliche : he nadde of no man Ey&yogh;e.
A-bysemare he bi-heold seint Iohan : þo he him sai&yogh;h bere on honde
Þis &yogh;ongue foul and þare-with pleye— : þare-to he hadde onde.
"Loke," he seide, "þis olde conIoun : in his olde liue,
Þat men holdez swuch prophete : alle oþur men to schriue!
wel bi-trufleth he þat folk. : here men mi&yogh;hten i-seo
hou he plei&yogh;ez with þis &yogh;ongue brid : he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;t wys beo."
¶ "Leoue broþur," quath seint Iohan : "ich bidde tel þou me
&YOGH;wat is þat þou berest on honde : and &yogh;ware-offe it seruez þe."
"Ane bouwe ich bere," quath þis oþur : "and Arewen also þer-to,
To scheoten wilde bestes with : and wilde foules also."
¶ "Biend þine bouwe," quath seint Ioan : "to loke &yogh;wat he can do!"
Þis &yogh;ongue Man nam and bende is bouwe : and bar it longue so.
Þare-aftur sone he nam is bouwe : and unbende it ase he couþe.
"&YOGH;wy dost þou so?" quath sein Iohan : "&yogh;wat schal he vnbend nouþe?"
"For he wole," quath þis oþur : "þe smartore dryue eft-sone
And þe betere dunt &yogh;yue to euerech þing : þat ich habbe with to done;
¶ For, &yogh;if ich hire bere longue i-bend : þe feblore heo wolle[al. wolde] beo
And euerech drau&yogh;ht þe worse driue— : þat may ech man[MS. man may] i-wite and seo."
"Leoue broþur," quath seint Iohan : "al-so it farez, i-wis,
Bi mannes heorte here on eorþe : þat feble and leoþi is.
&YOGH;if he is toward Iesu[MS. Iusu] crist : i-bend faste euere-mo,
Febli he schal and beo a-sad[al. al sad] : and is strencþe also[al. al] a-go;
And &yogh;if he is oþur-&yogh;wile onbend : and itorned to solaz,
he wole bieon eft-sone, &yogh;wane he is i-bend : stifore þane he er was,
And in godes seruise þe bet driue & duyre : and þare-to beon stif and strong.
Þare-fore mot ech holi man : solaci him a-mong
And tuyrne is herte to some truyfle : &yogh;wane he may ani i-se,
Þat he mouwe to godes seruise : þe stifore and þe strengore be.[This v. on the margin.]
Þe Ern is foul of alle foules : þat hey&yogh;est may fleo,
And &yogh;uyt he mot nede, to resten him : a-&yogh;ein to grounde teo;
hou mi&yogh;hte he euere fleon on hei&yogh;h : bote he reste him atþe grounde?
Nammore ne may mannes bodi : bote he reste him sum stounde.
Þare-fore, bel amy, þou mi&yogh;ht : herebi þat soþe[MS. þe soþe herebi þat soþe.] ise,
Þat for solaz man may þe betere : in godes seruise be."—
¶ Seint Iohan wende a-boute wide : and churche he liet a-rere,
And maude preostes and bischopes : þat folk for-to lere.
Ake Aristod[i]mus þe bischop : þat he tornede er to cristindom,
In þe Cite of Ephese : swiþe holi man bi-cam,
And ane churche of seint Iohan : in Ephese he arerde bliue—
And seint Iohan sethþe in þulke churche : wende out of þis liue.—
¶ A day ase þis holie man : his seruise hadde i-do,
A &yogh;oung man he say þare-bi-side : staleworþe and fair al-so;
Ake a li&yogh;ht red he was, and of þunne wit. : seint Iohan bi-heold him faste,
And opon a bischop þare-bi-side : his ei&yogh;ene a-non he caste:
"Ich bi-take þe," he seide, "in warde to wite : þis man here lo,
Þat þou him loke and norichi wel : þat he nou&yogh;t ne mis-do;
So þat þou me ansuerie of is warde : &yogh;wane þou me comest eft to;
witnesse ich take on ihesu crist : and on holie churche al-so."
¶ "Sire, wel fawe," þe bischop seide : þis &yogh;ongueman he tok wel softe.
Seint Iohan him chargede of is warde : and muneguede him wel ofte
Þat he him wuste swiþe wel : ase he answerie wolde;
And bi-tei&yogh;hte heom boþe Ihesu crist : and wende &yogh;wodere he scholde.
Þis bischop nam þis Ioliue man : and ladde hom to is inne,
And norichcede him softe and wel : seint Iones loue to winne,
And prechede him &yogh;eorne of Ihesu crist : to bi-nimen him his folie;
So þat þis &yogh;oungue man to guode turnde : and merci gan to crie,
And faire bar him and louede wel : god and seinte marie,
And dude al þat þe bischop wolde : and guod[al. hard] lif gan dri&yogh;e.
¶ Atþe laste þis bischop : sumdel is heorte gan wiende—
Ase ofte verlich bi-guynninge : flechchez atþen ende;
he soffrede þis &yogh;onge man to pleye : ant to muche habbe is wille,
And luyte and luyte don folie : and liet him al a-spille.
Formest he gan haunti wakes : and for compaygnie
he wax a syutor of tauernes : and siwede to glotonie;
Þo ne mi&yogh;hte he nou&yogh;ht beon with-oute : and turnde to lecherie
And bi-cam an holer strong : and tornede al-to folie.
¶ So longue, to holden up his folie : smale þingues he nam,
Aftur þe smale he tok þe grete : and strong þef he bi-cam;
So þat he hadde gret de-deyn : smale þefþes to do,
For bote it were þe grettore þing : he ne tornede nou&yogh;ht þer-to.
Atþe laste to þe[al. a] compaygnie of Outlawes : sone he gan gon;
Vnder non oþur he nolde beon : ake hext maister a-non;
Oþure þat erore maistres weren : bi-comen is men ech-on.
he robbede ouer-al to grounde : and slow&yogh;h[orig. slowen] al-so mani on,
More soruwe ne mi&yogh;hte beo : þane he dude in eche ende.
For of[te][MS. of] vuel chastingue : to folie wolie[al. wole] wiende.
¶ So þat seint Iohan in a time : to þat Bischop cam,
Aftur &yogh;wam he bi-tok him er in warde : guode &yogh;eme a-boute he nam.
"Sire bischop," he seide, "&yogh;eld me up : þat guode tresor, ich rede,
Þat in warde ich þe bi-tok : and a-countes of is dede!"
¶ Þo was þe bischop sore a-drad : "sire, merci," he seide,
"I-ne may him þe &yogh;elde nou&yogh;ht : for he is ded, ich dred[e]."
"Alas," quath sein Iohan, "&yogh;weþur he beo? : in &yogh;wat manere is þis?"
"Certes, sire," þe bischop seide, "a-&yogh;ein god ded he is,
his soule is ded, þei is bodi : &yogh;uyt a-liue beo;
For he is outlawe strong bicome : ase al þe contreye may seo.
Opon an hei&yogh;h hul he wonez : with outlawes mani on,
And lat a-quelle and robi also : alle þat he may of-gon."
¶ Þo bi-gan þis holi man : to sike and weope sore,
For deol is cloþus he to-drou&yogh; : "louerd," he seide, "þin ore,
Ane feble tresorer ich me ches : and þoru&yogh;h is feble lore
Mi deorewuyrþe tresur ich habbe [i-lore]! : ine truste to him non|more.
Alas, sire bischop, þi feble warde! : ine þonki þe nou&yogh;ht þarc-fore.
&YOGH;wane it non oþur nis, ich mot seche : þat þou me hast i-lore.
¶ Lat greyþi me an hors a-non : and ane man in ane stounde,
Þat he[al. om.] me mouwe þane wey teche : forto ich him habbe i-founde."
Þis holie man, þat feble was : and ouer-come nei&yogh;h with elde,
Opon a strong hors he Arnde forth : ouer mor and ouer felde.
So þat, þare þe outlawes weren : he cam atþe laste;
And some of þe schrewes weren al-&yogh;are : and nomen him wel faste,
To robbi him and to sle : and heten him holde him stille.
"Ov, beau freres," quath seint Ioan : "ich mot nede don ouwer wille;
¶ Ake ich bidde eou for eouwer cortesie : eouwer mayster latez [me] seo,
And latez him-sulf with me do : &yogh;wat is wille beo."
Wel i-Armed þe maister cam : prikie and ride faste;
And a-no[n] so he on þis holie man : his ei&yogh;ene a-feor caste,
And wuste wel þat he it was : him gan to schamie, so sore
Þat he bi-gan to fleo a-non : and ne kepte i-seo him non-more.
¶ A-non so sein Ioan þis i-sei&yogh;h : he Arnde aftur a-non
And siwede him al-so stifliche[al. [h]asteliche, r. hastifliche] : ase his hors mi&yogh;hte gon;
he Arnde ase þei he a &yogh;ung man were. : "mi sone," he seide, "þi ore,
&YOGH;wy fleustþou me? nam ich þi fader? : ne dred þe nou&yogh;t so sore!
Spek here with þi feble fader : vn-Armed and in elde!
Abid me nouþe, and ichulle for þe : ore louerd resun &yogh;elde.
Ich am &yogh;are þene deth a-fongue : for þine strongue pine.[A v. om.: As our louerd dude for us : & mi soule &yogh;iue for þine.]
Spek with me, bote þou more wolle : ich hote a-godes name!"
Þe oþur a-stunte and vnneþe[al. om.] a-bod : he ne mi&yogh;hte no[n] oþur[al. vnneþe he mi&yogh;te] for schame;
¶ He a-li&yogh;hte and vn-armede him : and weopinde ful sore
he ful to seint Iones fet : and cride him milce and ore,
And bi-hiet him stifliche a-godes name : þat he nold [misdo] namore,
Ake louien god and holi churche : and libbe al bi is lore.
So þat he was euereft more : guod man and stable i-nou&yogh;,
And bi seint Iones rede ladde is lif : and to alle guodnesse he drou&yogh;.—
¶ Seint [Iohan] leouede here so longue : and so mani his dawes were,
Þat he ne mi&yogh;hte nou&yogh;ht ouer þe eorþe go : bote ase is desciples him bere;
huy beren him, for feblesse and for elde : to churche with[al. mid] alle teone,
And euere-more he prechede hem : þat loue heom were bi-tweone.
Þo he was of an hondred &yogh;er : bote o &yogh;er wane vnneþe,
And seuene and sixti &yogh;er it was : aftur ore louerdes deþe,
¶ Ore louerd with is desciples cam to him : fram heouene up an hei&yogh;h,
"Cum forth," he seide, "mi frend, to me : þi time is comen nei&yogh;h;
hit is nei&yogh;h time þat þou come : to mine riche feste
with þine breþren in mine riche : for it[al. þat (for om.)] schal euere i-leste.
For þou schalt nouþe a-sonenday : þat þene fifte day heonne is,
Þe day of mine oprisingue : to me comen, i-wis."
¶ Þis holie man hiet his desciples : þat huy him to churche bere—
Þat of him and in his name : Aristod[i]mus[MS. Aristodinus] liet a-rere.
Þat folk cam sone þicke þudere : with deol and sor i-nou&yogh;h,
For hit was couth swiþe sone : þat he toward is ende drou&yogh;h.
¶ Þene sonen-ny&yogh;ht wel tyme : his seruise he gan to do,
And sethþe he gan þat folk to wisse : and to prechi al-so;
Atþe furste cocke þat creu&yogh; : he gan to prechie faste,
And for-to hei&yogh;h vnderne of þe daye : his prechingue i-laste.
Þo hiet he is desciples þat huy ane put : four-huyrned him made,
Faste bi-side þe hei&yogh;e weuede : with schouelene and with spade,
And þat huy casten out at þe churche-dore : þe eorþe, &yogh;eorne he bad.
With weop and with soruwe i-nou&yogh;h : þe put was þare i-mad.
¶ Þo þe put was al-&yogh;are i-maud : In alle heore ey&yogh;ene si&yogh;hte
Þis holie man wel softeliche : þudere in gan a-li&yogh;hte;
his hondene he huld up on hei&yogh;h : "swete louerd," he seide,
"Ich am cominde to þine feste : ase þou me erore bede.
¶ Louerd, muche ich þonki þe : þat it þi wille is
To þine gistningue cleopie [me] : for muche ich it wilni, i-wis.
Þine sones ich bi-take [þe] to loke : &yogh;wane i-ne may no lengore heom wite,
Þat holie churche, þine clene spouse : þoru&yogh; me þe hath bi-&yogh;ite.
Vnder-fong me with mine breþren : þat þou brou&yogh;htest with þe
Þo þou me bede to þine holie feste : and come aftur me."
¶ Þo cam þare a-boute þis holie man : so muche li&yogh;ht a-li&yogh;the,
Þat no man ne mi&yogh;hte for cler leome : habbe of him no si&yogh;hte.
Þis holie man him blessede : and wel softe a-doun he lay;
"Mine breþren," he seide, "i-blessede &yogh;e beon : and habbez nouþe guod day!"
¶ Þis guode man wende out of þis world : al-clene with-oute ech pine,
Ase he was clene in mayden-hod— : he cam to a swete fine.
Þat clere li&yogh;ht þat a-boute him was : laste almest ane tyde;
Þat folk ne sei&yogh;en nou&yogh;t of him— : faste huy weopen and cride.
Þo þis li&yogh;th a-passed was : huy [lokede] in þe put to grounde:
Þare-inne of þis holie Man : no-þing huy ne sei&yogh;en ne founde;
Þare nas inne nou&yogh;ht bote smale greynes : þat heo mi&yogh;hten vnder-&yogh;ite—
Þat is holi þing and is i-cleoped : Manna in holi write,
Þat ore louerd wole[al. wule, while] in fourme of reyn : fram heouene to vrþe sende
Þe children of Israhel to heore mete : þo huy of[MS. to] Egypte wenden.
¶ Þis Manna, þat holie greyn : &yogh;uyt to þis day dez springue
Op of þat put, þat manie men : bringuez to botningue.
Non oþur þing of seint Iohan : men ne mi&yogh;hten on eorþe finde;
Al-clene, ich wene, in heouene he is : þare nis no leome bi-hinde.
Of euerech haluwe men founden for-soþe : þat bodi bi-leue here,
Bote of ore lauedy and of him : þat maydenes weren so clere.
Fayr a þing is Maiden-hod : ase it is on heom i-sene!
In þis Manere seint Iohan wende : of þis eorthþelich lif, ich wene.—
¶ Seint Edward þat was nouþe late : In enguelonde ore king,
Þis holie seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : he louede þoru&yogh;h alle þing;
Men ne scholde him no-þing bidde : for þe loue of seint Iohan
Þat he mi&yogh;hte do with-oute blame : þat he ne grauntede a-non.
A day þare cam a pouere man : with ful dreori mod
And bad him for seint Iohanes loue : þat he &yogh;eue him sum guod.
¶ Seint Edward him bi-þou&yogh;hte : þo, he ne hadde þare no-þing
For-to &yogh;yue þis pouere Man : bote ane guyldene ring.
Þane ryng he louede wel i-nou&yogh; : and for þe loue of seint Iohan
&YOGH;uy[t] he hine &yogh;af þe pouere manne. : and he wende him forth a-non.
¶ Þare-aftur sethþe seint Iohan cam : to a kny&yogh;ht of Enguelonde,
Ase he was bi-&yogh;eonde se : Auntres for-to fonde;
"Wiend," he seide, "&yogh;wane þou hom comest : to Edward, eower king,
And sei&yogh;e þat he for &yogh;was loue : he &yogh;af þeosne ryng
Sende him here his ryng a-&yogh;eyn : and þonki him also."
Þo þis kny&yogh;ht cam to enguelonde : his erinde he gan do.
¶ Seint Edward i-kneu&yogh;h wel þane ring : and þare-bi onder-stod anon
Þat þe pouere man þat he him &yogh;af : was þe guode seint Iohan.[Harl. adds:]
Nouþe seint Iohan þe Ewangelist : &yogh;yf it þi wille is,
Beode ore Erinde, þat we moten : come to heouene blis. AMEN.
Þulke ring is &yogh;ut at westmynstre : for relik ido,
As me scheweþ pelegrims : þat ofte comeþ þerto.
